result.execSummary:
The defendant Desmound D Cleveland was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Alter Price (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time.
Apply 10 days sentence credit, if revoked.
Consecutive to: any other sentence.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution to be paid to Walgreens as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
DNA surcharge is to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by Agent.

Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  
No contact with Walgreens.   
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

timeConds.notes:
STAYED - to be used at Agent's discretion.
Agent to determine Huber or Straight time.
At a rate of $10.00 per hour to help offset fine/costs.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Desmound D Cleveland

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Jail/HOC
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Desmound D Cleveland in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty.

Court orders the following: 
Ct. 1:
- 6 months jail straight time - consecutive -  STAYED for 1 year Probation - concurrent  - 10 days credit if revoked
- Court Costs of $243.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation 
- Restitution of $12.99 to be paid to Walgreens to be paid as a Condition of Probation.
- DNA Surcharge of $200.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Conditions of  Probation:   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling or any other approved activity by agent.  No contact with Walgreens.   Mental Health Evaluation. Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 40 hours of community service at a rate of $10.00 per hour to offset the fine and costs as a Condition of Probation.
- 30 days jail Condition Time (nonworking hours) STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion.
with attached witness list filed by the State.

Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 7/9/15 and 7/14/15.

Jury status hearing on July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial - 12 person on July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Desmound D Cleveland in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Statements by Atty. Fragoso regarding an appearance today in Judge Foster's court regarding non-appearance at the DRC and why the defendant is in custody at the moment.
State believes cash bail is appropriate today. Argument by Atty. Fragoso. Court set bail at $200.00 cash.  Statements by Atty. Fragoso.  Court vacates cash bail and bail to remain as signature.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for July 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury status hearing scheduled for July 9, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Hearing on June 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Desmound D Cleveland in court with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant is participating in an ATR. Defense requests another date. Defense requests that a capias be issued and stayed.   Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 10:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 4/30/15.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 5/27/15.
Hearing on May 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing  Defendant to have no contact with store listed in the Criminal Complaint.

Defendant Desmound D Cleveland in court, in custody, with attorney Jorge R Fragoso.   Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for bail motion. Defense requests bail be modified. State has no objection. Court grants request and modifies bail to $500.00 signature bond with the same conditions previously ordered.  Motion for substitution of Judge withdrawn by Defense. Court will give another date. Defense to let Court know on the next date if this matter will be set for a plea or trial.  Hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Motion hearing on April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
